intro: Bucco hirta, commonly known as the hairy bucco, is a flowering plant native to the Cape Province of South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It thrives in well-drained sandy soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Due to its unique appearance and ecological role, it is often cultivated in rock gardens and xeriscapes.
